Column Comment.0: SEISMIC PATCH: This table is used to capture generalized recording patch designs.Details about the patch design are contained in the table SEIS_PATCH_DESC.
Column Comment.1: PATCH DESCRIPTION IDENTIFIER: Unique identifier for the patch detailinformation contained in this table.
Column Comment.2: ACTIVE INDICATOR: A Y/N flag indicating whether this row of data is currently eitheractive / valid (Y) or inactive / invalid (N).
Column Comment.3: EFFECTIVE DATE: The date that the data in this row first came into effect.
Column Comment.4: END CHANNEL: the identifier for the last channel on this continguous linear segmentof the patch.
Column Comment.5: END STATION ID: This column is not validated to simplify data input. The stationnumber to which the end channel is attached.
Column Comment.6: END X OFFSET DISTANCE: The offset distance from nominal position.
Column Comment.7: END Y OFFSET DISTANCE: The offset distance from nominal position.
Column Comment.8: END Z OFFSET DISTANCE: The offset distance from nominal position.
Column Comment.9: EXPIRY DATE: The date that the data in this row was no longer active or in effect.
Column Comment.10: OFFSET ORIGINAL UNITS OF MEASURE: the original units of measure for all offsetvalues in this table.
Column Comment.11: ROW_MANAGEMENT_GUID: This value may be used to provide a global uniqueidentifier for this row of data. Use of this column is not mandatory, but if used,optional PPDM NOT NULL and UNIQUE INDEX constraints provided in the datamodel DDL should be created.
Column Comment.12: RECORDED LINE: The name for this line in the patch.
Column Comment.13: REMARK: Narrative remarks relating to this row of data.
Column Comment.14: SOURCE: The individual, company, state, or government agency designated as thesource of information for this row.
Column Comment.15: START CHANNEL: the identifier for the first channel on this continguous linearsegment of the patch.
Column Comment.16: START STATION ID: This column is not validated to simplify data input. The stationnumber to which the start channel is attached.
Column Comment.17: START X OFFSET DISTANCE: The offset distance from nominal position.
Column Comment.18: START Y OFFSET DISTANCE: The offset distance from nominal position.
Column Comment.19: START Z OFFSET DISTANCE: The offset distance from nominal position.
Column Comment.20: ROW CHANGED BY: Application login id of the user who last changed the row.
Column Comment.21: ROW CHANGED DATE: System date of the last time the row was changed.
Column Comment.22: ROW CREATED BY: System user who created this row of data.
Column Comment.23: ROW CREATED DATE: Date that the row was created on.
Column Comment.24: ROW_EFFECTIVE_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of datais effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row of data wasmade available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.25: ROW_EXPIRY_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of data isno longer effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row ofdata was no longer available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.26: PPDM ROW QUALITY: A set of values indicating the quality of data in this row,usually with reference to the method or procedures used to load the data, althoughother types of quality reference are permitted.
